question.title: Is there a way to detect if other app is using the camera?
question.body:
I'm trying to make an app that protect android device from phishing app in which users have applied permission by accident.
The app detects camera activation by other app, and it deactivate the camera if the camera is activated by other app.

So is there a way to know if the camera is on? and is there a way to disable the camera?

I found CameraManager.AvailabilityCallback, but I am not sure if it is available in current versions.

Also I tried to find a way to disable camera but could not find it.

Also there are some camera block apps like "Camera Block: Guard & Anti spy" by BytePioneers where it stops camera before an app tries to use it. I am curious how this kind of app work.
